## Biography
Steve Harris is an NHS Critical Care Consultant, and Honorary Associate Professor at UCL Institute of Health Informatics. He has held fellowships from Wellcome, and the Health Foundation, and won more than Â£5m in grant funding (UCLH Charity, EPSRC, NIHR/NHS-X) in the last 5 years. He is a co-investigator in [CHIMERA](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/chimera/),  the [Wellcome Innovation Flagship Critical Care Asia](https://wellcome.org/what-we-do/our-work/innovations-flagships/funded-projects#innovation-in-low--and-middle-income-countries--d06a), and co-leads the [NIHR Health Informatics Collaborative for Critical Care](https://hic.nihr.ac.uk/critical+care). At UCLH, he led the implementation of the [Experimental Medicine Application Platform (EMAP)](https://www.uclhospitals.brc.nihr.ac.uk/clinical-research-informatics-unit/data-infrastructure) that is bringing machine learning back to the bedside leading to [commendations](https://www.hdruk.org/case-studies/emap-experimental-medicine-application-platform/) from HDR-UK for its role in the pandemic response.  He co-directs the data science training programme for UCLH.
